snippet: Prime Minister Abe needs to postpone a tax increase and move forward with structural reforms.
abstract: Editorial warns that shrinking of Japanese economy by 7.1 percent in second quarter of 2014 may signal that country's hard-won recovery is stalling; holds that Prime Min Shinzo Abe's economic policies were effective early on but have flagged, and asserts that further reforms are essential to Japan's recovery.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Abe needs to postpone a tax increase and move forward with structural reforms.
